member.name: IEnumSTATPROPSTG.Clone
member.summary: The Clone method creates an enumerator that contains the same enumeration state as the current structure enumerator. Using this method, a client can record a particular point in the enumeration sequence and then return to that point later. The new enumerator supports the same interface.

param.name: ppenum
param.code: A pointer to the variable that receives the IEnumSTATPROPSTG interface pointer.
param.para: If the method is unsuccessful, the value of the ppenum parameter is undefined.

returns.para: This method supports the following return values.

member.name: IEnumSTATPROPSTG.Next
member.summary: The Next method retrieves a specified number of structures, that follow subsequently in the enumeration sequence. If fewer than the requested number of structures exist in the enumeration sequence, it retrieves the remaining STATPROPSTG structures.
member.param: The number of structures retrieved in the rgelt parameter.

returns.para: This method supports the following return values.

listheader.description: The number of structures returned is equal to the number specified in the celt parameter.
The number of structures returned is less than the number specified in the celt parameter.

member.name: IEnumSTATPROPSTG.Reset
member.summary: The Reset method resets the enumeration sequence to the beginning of the structure array.

returns.para: This method supports the S_OK return value.

listheader.description: The enumeration sequence was successfully reset to the beginning of the enumeration.

member.name: IEnumSTATPROPSTG.Skip
member.summary: The Skip method skips the specified number of structures in the enumeration sequence.
member.param: The number of structures to skip.
member.returns: This method supports the following return values:

summary.para: TheIEnumSTATPROPSTG interface iterates through an array of structures. The STATPROPSTG structures contain statistical data about properties in a property set. IEnumSTATPROPSTG has the same methods as all enumerator interfaces: , , , and.

The implementation defines the order in which the properties in the set are enumerated. Properties that are present when the enumerator is created, and are not removed during the enumeration, will be enumerated only once. Properties added or deleted while the enumeration is in progress may or may not be enumerated, but will never be enumerated more than once.
Reserved property identifiers, properties with a property ID of 0 (dictionary), 1 (code page indicator), or greater than or equal to 0x80000000 are not enumerated.

Enumeration of a nonsimple property does not necessarily indicate that the property can be read successfully through a call to . This is because the performance overhead of checking existence of the indirect stream or storage is prohibitive during property enumeration.
